Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gilran.chess.board.PositionBase
      • com.gilran.chess.board.Position

  • public class Position
extends PositionBase
    A position on the chess board.
    Author:
    Gil Ran

    • Field Detail

      • ROOK_INITIAL_POSITION

        private static final java.util.Map<Piece.Color,java.util.Map<CastlingRights.Side,Coordinate>> ROOK_INITIAL_POSITION
        Rook starting positions. Used for castling.

      • legalMoves

        private java.util.Map<Piece.Color,java.util.Map<Coordinate,java.util.Map<Coordinate,Move>>> legalMoves
        The legal moves in the position.

        The outermost map's key is the color of one side, and the value is the legal moves for pieces of that color.

        The second level map's key is the from-square of the move, and the value is the legal moves from that square.

        The innermost map's key is the to-square of the move, and the value is the move object itself.

      • promotionPieceType

        private java.util.Map<Piece.Color,Piece.Type> promotionPieceType
        The piece to which pawns are promoted for each side.

      • previousPositions

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> previousPositions
        A map of previous game positions.

        The map is from the FEN representation of the position to the number of times it was seen.

        The map is used to test for threefold repetition, thus every time a piece is captured it may be cleaned, as all previous positions will not be seen again.

      • status

        private Proto.GameStatus status
        The game's status.

      • outstandingDrawOffer

        private Piece.Color outstandingDrawOffer
        The player who offered draw. Null if none of the players offered draw.

      • setStatus

        public boolean setStatus(Proto.GameStatus status)
        Sets the game's status. Only allows setting the game status to statuses not derived from the board position. Returns true iff the status was set.

      • revert

        private void revert(java.util.List<Move> moves,
          Piece capturedPiece)
        Reverts moves, without any legallity tests.

        Handles more than one move, because castling involves two moves.

      • apply

        private Piece apply(java.util.List<Move> moves)
        Applies moves in the position.

        Only updates piece locations, without updating any other property of the position. This way, it is possible to easily revert the move, and thus simulate moves in order to test whether the move is illegal due to being checked after the move. The option to revert is also the reason for returning the captured piece.

        Parameters:
        move - The move to apply.
        Returns:
        The piece that was captured in the move (may be null if no piece was captured).

      • move

        public java.util.List<Move> move(Coordinate from,
                        Coordinate to)
        Makes a move in the position.
        Parameters:
        from - The coordinate from which the piece moves.
        to - The coordinate to which the piece moves.
        Returns:
        The moves perfomed. If empty, the requested move is not legal in the position. In case of castling, both the king move and the rook move are returned.

      • completeCastle

        private Move completeCastle(Move move)
        Completes a castling move.
        Parameters:
        move - The king's castling move.
        Returns:
        The rook's castling move.

      • updateCastlingRights

        Parameters:
        move - The move made.
        piece - The moved piece.

      • updateLegalMoves

        private void updateLegalMoves()
        Updates the legal moves map.

      • isThreefoldRepetition

        private boolean isThreefoldRepetition()
        Returns true iff the current position was seen for the third time.

        Updates the previous positions map for use in the next tests for threefold repetition.

      • createCandidateMoves

        private java.util.Map<Piece.Color,java.util.Map<Coordinate,java.util.Map<Coordinate,Move>>> createCandidateMoves()
        Creates candidate moves for all the pieces in the position.

      • removeIllegalMoves

        private boolean removeIllegalMoves(java.util.List<Move> candidates)
        Removes the illegal moves from the candidate moves list.
        Parameters:
        candidates - A list of candidate moves.
        Returns:
        true iff all moves were removed.

      • isLegalMove

        private boolean isLegalMove(Move move)
        Tests if a move is valid.

        Assumes that the move is valid by the piece rules, and only checks the move against the position.

        Ignores the active player, as legal moves of both sides may be checked using this method, regardless of who's the active player (in order to test for checks).

        Parameters:
        move - A move.
        Returns:
        false if the given move is legal in this position. May return true for illegal moves, as the move is considered a candidate move that the piece returned.

      • removeThreatened

        private void removeThreatened(Piece.Color color)
        Removes from the legal moves map for the given color moves that are illegal due to threatened coordinates.

      • anyThreatened

        private boolean anyThreatened(java.lang.Iterable<Coordinate> coordinates,
                    Piece.Color color,
                    java.util.Map<Piece.Color,java.util.Map<Coordinate,java.util.Map<Coordinate,Move>>> movesMap)
        Tests if any of the given coordinates are threatened by a piece of the given color.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The coordinates.
        color - The color of the threatening side.
        movesMap - The moves map of moves to use as legal moves.
        Returns:
        true iff at least one of the coordinates is threatened by pieces of the given color.

      • isThreatened

        private boolean isThreatened(Coordinate coordinate,
                   Piece.Color color,
                   java.util.Map<Piece.Color,java.util.Map<Coordinate,java.util.Map<Coordinate,Move>>> movesMap)
        Tests if a coordinate is threatened by the active player.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The coordinate.
        color - The color of the threatning side.
        movesMap - The moves map of moves to use as legal moves.
        Returns:
        true iff the coordinate is threatened.

      • isChecked

        private boolean isChecked(Piece.Color color,
                java.util.Map<Piece.Color,java.util.Map<Coordinate,java.util.Map<Coordinate,Move>>> movesMap)
        Tests if the king of the given color is checked.
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the king to test for checks.
        movesMap - The map of moves to use as legal moves.
        Returns:
        true iff the king is checked.

      • removeChecked

        private void removeChecked(Piece.Color color)
        Removes from the legal moves map for the given color moves that are illegal because making them will put the king in a check.
